canonical_explanation.text: Elementary shapes are classified by their measurements. Angles are classified as acute (< 90), right (= 90), obtuse (> 90 and < 180), straight (= 180), reflex (> 180 and < 360), and complete (= 360). Triangles are classified by sides (equilateral, isosceles, scalene) and by angles (acute, right, obtuse). Quadrilaterals include rectangles, squares, parallelograms, rhombuses, and trapeziums.
rules: Rule 1: Acute < 90, Right = 90, Obtuse = 90 to 180, Straight = 180, Reflex = 180 to 360
Rule 2: Equilateral = 3 equal sides; Isosceles = 2 equal sides; Scalene = no equal sides
Rule 3: Rectangle: opposite sides equal, all angles 90. Square: all sides equal, all angles 90
Rule 4: Parallelogram: opposite sides parallel and equal. Rhombus: all sides equal, opposite angles equal
Rule 5: 3D shapes have faces (flat surfaces), edges (where faces meet), and vertices (corners)

questions.question_text: A ruler is used to measure:
questions.explanation_correct: A ruler is used to measure the length of line segments in units like cm or mm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Angles are measured with a protractor. Weight with a balance. Temperature with a thermometer. A ruler measures length.

questions.question_text: An angle measuring 90 degrees is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: An angle of exactly 90 degrees is called a right angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Acute < 90, Right = 90, Obtuse is between 90 and 180, Straight = 180.

questions.question_text: An angle measuring 135 degrees is classified as:
questions.explanation_correct: 135 degrees is between 90 and 180, so it is an obtuse angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 90 < 135 < 180, so it falls in the obtuse range.

questions.question_text: A straight angle measures:
questions.explanation_correct: A straight angle measures exactly 180 degrees and forms a straight line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A straight angle looks like a straight line and measures 180 degrees.

questions.question_text: An angle measuring 200 degrees is a reflex angle.
questions.explanation_correct: A reflex angle is between 180 and 360 degrees. 200 degrees falls in this range, so it is a reflex angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Reflex angles are greater than 180 and less than 360. 200 is in this range.

questions.question_text: A triangle with all three sides equal is called:
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has all three sides equal. Each angle measures 60 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Equilateral = 3 equal sides, Isosceles = 2 equal sides, Scalene = 0 equal sides.

questions.question_text: A triangle with one angle equal to 90 degrees is called:
questions.explanation_correct: A triangle with one right angle (90 degrees) is called a right triangle or right-angled triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A right triangle has exactly one 90-degree angle. Acute has all angles < 90. Obtuse has one angle > 90.

questions.question_text: A triangle with sides 5 cm, 5 cm, and 8 cm is:
questions.explanation_correct: Two sides are equal (5 cm each), so it is an isosceles triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Two equal sides makes it isosceles. All equal = equilateral. None equal = scalene.

questions.question_text: A quadrilateral with all four sides equal and all angles 90 degrees is a:
questions.explanation_correct: A square has all four sides equal AND all four angles equal to 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rectangle has equal angles but not necessarily equal sides. Rhombus has equal sides but not necessarily right angles. Only a square has both.

questions.question_text: A parallelogram has:

options.text: Only one pair of parallel sides

questions.explanation_correct: A parallelogram has two pairs of opposite sides that are parallel and equal in length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Parallelogram: opposite sides are parallel and equal. A trapezium has only one pair of parallel sides.

questions.question_text: A cube has how many faces?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 6 faces (all are identical squares).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube: 6 faces, 12 edges, 8 vertices.

questions.question_text: How many edges does a cuboid have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid has 12 edges (4 on top, 4 on bottom, 4 vertical).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cuboid: 6 faces, 12 edges, 8 vertices.

questions.question_text: An angle less than 90 degrees is called a/an ___ angle.
questions.explanation_correct: Angles less than 90 degrees are called acute angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 0 to 90 = acute, 90 = right, 90 to 180 = obtuse.

questions.question_text: If two line segments measure 4.5 cm and 4.50 cm, they are:
questions.explanation_correct: 4.5 cm = 4.50 cm. Trailing zeros do not change the value. They are equal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 4.5 and 4.50 are the same number. The line segments are equal in length.

questions.question_text: How many right angles make a complete angle (full turn)?
questions.explanation_correct: A complete angle = 360 degrees. 360/90 = 4 right angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Full turn = 360 degrees. Each right angle = 90 degrees. 360/90 = 4.

questions.question_text: A triangle has angles 60, 60, and 60 degrees. It is:
questions.explanation_correct: All angles are 60 degrees (equal), so all sides are equal (equilateral). All angles are less than 90, so it is also acute.
questions.explanation_incorrect: All angles equal means equilateral. All angles < 90 means acute. So it is equilateral and acute.

questions.question_text: Can a triangle have two obtuse angles?

options.text: No, because the sum would exceed 180
Only if the third angle is 0

questions.explanation_correct: Each obtuse angle > 90. Two obtuse angles would sum to more than 180, which violates the angle sum property. So a triangle cannot have two obtuse angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sum of angles = 180. Two angles > 90 would already exceed 180. Not possible.

questions.question_text: A rhombus is different from a square because:

options.text: Its angles need not be 90 degrees
Its opposite sides are not parallel

questions.explanation_correct: Both a rhombus and a square have all 4 sides equal. But a rhombus's angles need not be 90 degrees, while a square's must be.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rhombus: all sides equal, opposite angles equal, but angles not necessarily 90. Square: all sides equal AND all angles 90.

questions.question_text: Every square is a rectangle.
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has opposite sides equal and all angles 90 degrees. A square satisfies all these conditions (with the extra property of all sides being equal). So every square is a rectangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square meets all criteria of a rectangle (right angles, opposite sides equal) plus has all sides equal. So every square is a special rectangle.

questions.question_text: A cylinder has:
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder has 3 faces (2 circular bases and 1 curved surface), 2 edges (circles where bases meet the curved surface), and 0 vertices.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cylinder: 2 flat circular faces + 1 curved face = 3 faces, 2 circular edges, 0 vertices.

questions.question_text: What is the angle between the hands of a clock at 3 o'clock?
questions.explanation_correct: At 3 o'clock, the minute hand points to 12 and the hour hand to 3. The angle between them = 3 x 30 = 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each hour mark on a clock = 30 degrees. From 12 to 3 = 3 x 30 = 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: A triangle with sides 3 cm, 4 cm, and 5 cm is:
questions.explanation_correct: All sides different = scalene. Check: 3^2 + 4^2 = 9 + 16 = 25 = 5^2. Pythagorean triplet, so it is right-angled.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 3, 4, 5 are all different (scalene). 9+16=25=5^2, so it forms a right triangle.

questions.question_text: A cone has ___ vertex/vertices.
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has 1 vertex (the apex/tip), 1 curved face, 1 flat circular face, and 1 edge.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone has exactly 1 vertex at its pointed tip.

questions.question_text: A trapezium has:

options.text: Exactly one pair of parallel sides

questions.explanation_correct: A trapezium has exactly one pair of parallel sides (called the parallel sides or bases).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Two pairs of parallel sides = parallelogram. One pair = trapezium. No parallel sides = general quadrilateral.

questions.question_text: How many degrees are there in a complete turn (full rotation)?
questions.explanation_correct: A complete turn (full rotation) measures 360 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Quarter turn = 90, half turn = 180, three-quarter turn = 270, full turn = 360.

questions.question_text: The instrument used to measure angles is:
questions.explanation_correct: A protractor is used to measure angles in degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A ruler measures length, a compass draws circles, a set square helps draw angles. A protractor measures angles.

questions.question_text: A sphere has:
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere has 1 curved face, 0 edges, and 0 vertices.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is perfectly round with no edges or vertices and just one curved surface.

questions.question_text: A triangle has angles 40, 60, and 80 degrees. It is:
questions.explanation_correct: Sum = 40+60+80 = 180 (valid). All angles < 90, so it is an acute-angled triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: All three angles are less than 90 degrees, making it an acute-angled triangle.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a property of a rectangle?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has opposite sides equal, all angles 90 degrees, and equal diagonals. But all four sides need not be equal (that would be a square).
questions.explanation_incorrect: All sides equal is a property of a square or rhombus, not a general rectangle.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has a triangular base and 3 triangular faces meeting at a point?
questions.explanation_correct: A triangular pyramid (tetrahedron) has a triangular base and 3 triangular faces meeting at an apex.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A triangular prism has 2 triangular faces and 3 rectangular faces. A pyramid with a triangular base = tetrahedron.

questions.question_text: The angle between the hands of a clock at 6 o'clock is:
questions.explanation_correct: At 6 o'clock, the minute hand is at 12 and the hour hand at 6. They form a straight line = 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: From 12 to 6 = 6 hours x 30 degrees = 180 degrees (a straight angle).

questions.question_text: An equilateral triangle is also an isosceles triangle.
questions.explanation_correct: An isosceles triangle has at least 2 equal sides. An equilateral triangle has 3 equal sides, which means it also has at least 2 equal sides. So every equilateral triangle is isosceles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Equilateral has 3 equal sides, which includes having 2 equal sides. So it is a special case of isosceles.

questions.question_text: Which quadrilateral has all sides equal but angles are NOT 90 degrees?
questions.explanation_correct: A rhombus has all sides equal, but its angles need not be 90 degrees (they are only 90 when it is a square).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rectangle: right angles but sides not all equal. Square: all equal sides AND right angles. Rhombus: all equal sides but not necessarily right angles.

questions.question_text: A triangular prism has ___ faces, ___ edges, and ___ vertices.
questions.explanation_correct: A triangular prism: 5 faces (2 triangular + 3 rectangular), 9 edges, 6 vertices.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Triangular prism: 2 triangular bases + 3 rectangular sides = 5 faces; 3+3+3 = 9 edges; 3+3 = 6 vertices.

questions.question_text: Two line segments of length 5 cm and 3 cm overlap by 1 cm. The total length of the combined figure is:
questions.explanation_correct: Total = 5 + 3 - 1 (overlap) = 7 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When segments overlap, subtract the overlap: 5 + 3 - 1 = 7 cm.

questions.question_text: If two angles are supplementary and one is 65 degrees, the other is:
questions.explanation_correct: Supplementary angles add to 180 degrees. Other angle = 180 - 65 = 115 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Supplementary = sum is 180. 180 - 65 = 115.

questions.question_text: Two angles of a triangle are 45 and 90 degrees. The third angle is:
questions.explanation_correct: Sum of angles = 180. Third angle = 180 - 45 - 90 = 45 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 180 - 45 - 90 = 45 degrees. This is a right isosceles triangle.

questions.question_text: 1 cm = ___ mm.
questions.explanation_correct: 1 centimetre = 10 millimetres.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about every parallelogram?

options.text: Opposite sides are equal and parallel

questions.explanation_correct: In every parallelogram, opposite sides are equal in length and parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not all parallelograms have equal sides (that's a rhombus), right angles (that's a rectangle), or equal diagonals (that's a rectangle).

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has a flat circular base and a curved surface meeting at a point?
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has a flat circular base and a curved surface that tapers to a point (apex).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder has 2 circular bases and no apex. A cone has 1 circular base and an apex.

questions.question_text: If two angles are complementary and one is 35 degrees, the other is:
questions.explanation_correct: Complementary angles add to 90 degrees. Other angle = 90 - 35 = 55 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Complementary = sum is 90. 90 - 35 = 55.

questions.question_text: A triangle with no equal sides is called:
questions.explanation_correct: A scalene triangle has all three sides of different lengths.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scalene = no equal sides. Isosceles = 2 equal. Equilateral = 3 equal.

questions.question_text: Every rectangle is a:
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has opposite sides equal and parallel, which satisfies the definition of a parallelogram. So every rectangle is a parallelogram.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not every rectangle is a square (needs equal sides) or rhombus (needs equal sides). But every rectangle IS a parallelogram.

questions.question_text: Euler's formula for 3D shapes states: F + V - E = ?
questions.explanation_correct: Euler's formula: Faces + Vertices - Edges = 2. For example, a cube: 6 + 8 - 12 = 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: F + V - E = 2 for all convex polyhedra. Cube: 6+8-12=2. Tetrahedron: 4+4-6=2.

questions.question_text: Which is longer: a line segment from A to B measuring 5 cm, or a curved path from A to B measuring 5 cm?
questions.explanation_correct: Both measure 5 cm. Length is length regardless of whether the path is straight or curved. They are equal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both paths measure 5 cm. The measurement doesn't depend on shape â€” both are 5 cm long.

questions.question_text: The angle between North and East directions is ___ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: North and East are perpendicular directions. The angle between them is 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: On a compass, N to E is a quarter turn = 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: A triangle with angles 30, 60, and 90 degrees has sides in which classification?
questions.explanation_correct: All three angles are different (30, 60, 90), so all three sides must be different. This is a scalene triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Different angles mean different side lengths. 30-60-90 triangle has all different sides, so it is scalene.

questions.question_text: Three angles of a quadrilateral are 80, 95, and 110 degrees. The fourth angle is:
questions.explanation_correct: Sum of angles = 360. Fourth angle = 360 - 80 - 95 - 110 = 75 degrees.

questions.question_text: How many vertices does a cube have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 8 vertices (corners). It also has 6 faces and 12 edges.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cube: 6 faces, 12 edges, 8 vertices. Check: 6+8-12 = 2 (Euler's formula).

questions.question_text: If you make a quarter turn clockwise starting from North, you face:
questions.explanation_correct: A quarter turn clockwise from North = 90 degrees clockwise = East.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Clockwise from North: quarter turn (90 degrees) = East, half turn (180) = South, three-quarter turn (270) = West.
